comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: possibly British/Commonwealth troops in WW2, looks like a Vickers machinegun?

comment.author: 26887305@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/66151649@N02] those are likely US troops training pre-war; note the jodhpurs and the canteens which are US design. They wore those helmets until the M1 helmet was introduced in 1941. The gun looks like a Browning M1917.

Who knows who they are though.

comment.author: 27541657@N07
comment._content: Kevin, I believe you are correct.  It also appears that the gun is not on a tripod, but is on an early wheeled apparatus.  Strange setup?

comment.author: 27541657@N07
comment._content:
Kevin, I am pretty sure you are correct.  Notice the old 45 colts in the WW I type holsters.  Also, the gun is mounted on something with wheels that I don't recognize, probably also from WW I.
We have a WW I vintage belt and holster that looks very similar.
